io.froilanandfriends.atm

Class ATM

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.froilanandfriends.atm.ATM

  • public class ATM
extends java.lang.Object
    This class houses the core ATM functionality, including withdrawals, deposits, and ensuring that the ATM's maximum capacity is not exceeded. It also handles admin user functions such as emptying and refilling the withdrawal and deposit trays. The class is implemented as a singleton in order to avoid creating more than one instance at a time.

    • Method Detail

      • getATM

        public static ATM getATM()
        Getter method that returns the current singleton instance of the class.
        Returns:
        A reference to current singleton ATM instance.

      • isFirstOn

        public static boolean isFirstOn()
        Returns true if the ATM is booting up for the first time.
        Returns:
        True or false.

      • setFirstOn

        public static void setFirstOn(boolean firstOn)
        Allows admin to set the firstOn flag to false after ATM is configured initially.
        Parameters:
        firstOn - A boolean flag indicating whether the ATM is booting up for the first time.

      • withdraw

        public boolean withdraw(int amountToWithdraw)
        Withdraws cash from the ATM in increments of ten- or twenty-dollar bills. Rejects the transaction if the requested amount is not divisible by ten or if the withdrawal amount exceeds the current value of the ATM's withdrawal tray. If the transaction is successful, decreases both the ATM's current balance and the number of bills in the machine. Covers as much of the amount as possible with twenties, then covers the rest with tens.
        Parameters:
        amountToWithdraw - An integer specifying the requested withdrawal amount.
        Returns:
        True if deposit is successful, false if unsuccessful.

      • reloadWithdrawalTray

        public boolean reloadWithdrawalTray(int twenties,
                                    int tens)
        Provides admin functionality to reload the withdrawal tray with any number of tens and/or twenties. Rejects the reload if the amount would exceed the ATM's total bill capacity. If successful, increases both the ATM's current balance and the number of bills in the withdrawal tray.
        Parameters:
        twenties - An integer specifiying the number of twenties to be loaded.
        tens - An integer specifiying the number of tens to be loaded.
        Returns:
        True if transaction was successful, false if it was not.

      • deposit

        public boolean deposit(int amount)
        Allows customers to deposit any whole number amount, provided that the amount does not exceed the ATM's total bill capacity. If successful, increases both the ATM's current balance and the number of bills in the deposit tray. Assumes that the amount consists of the greatest number of twenties possible, with the rest covered by a combination of tens, fives, and ones.
        Parameters:
        amount - An integer specifying the amount to deposit (the ATM will only accept deposits in bills).
        Returns:
        True if transaction is successful, false if unsuccessful.

      • emptyDepositTray

        public void emptyDepositTray()
        Provides admin functionality to empty the ATM's deposit tray.

      • getDepositTray

        public int getDepositTray()
        Returns the current number of bills in the ATM's deposit tray.
        Returns:
        An integer specifying the number of bills in the deposity tray.

      • getDepositValue

        public int getDepositValue()
        Returns the current dollar value of the ATM's deposit tray.
        Returns:
        An integer specifying the value of the deposit tray.

      • getWithdrawlTray

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getWithdrawlTray()
        Returns the current number of bills in the ATM's withdrawal tray.
        Returns:
        A HashMap with keys 20 and 10 that track the total number of twenties and tens in the ATM's withdrawal tray.

      • getATMBalance

        public int getATMBalance()
        Returns the current dollar value of the ATM's withdrawal tray. Does NOT include the value of the deposit tray.
        Returns:
        An integer specifying the dollar value of the withdrawal tray.

      • start

        public void start()
        Initializes UserManager

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
